intro: Hieracium lobomischodes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium lobomischodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils.
